DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Primary Site Gross Tissue Excision Outcome Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the type of result of a diagnostic or treatment procedure often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue visible to the naked eye, of which relating to or involving or used in surgery. Resection is done at the primary site of the tissue in relation to its surroundings.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Primary Site Gross Tissue Excision Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the result of a diagnostic or treatment procedure often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue visible to the naked eye, of which relating to or involving or used in surgery. Resection is done at the primary site of the tissue in relation to its surroundings.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredName: Primary Site Gross Tissue Excision Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.:A position in relation to its surroundings.:Visible to the naked eye.:An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.
A position in relation to its surroundings.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

PermissibleValues.value: Debulking with visible tumor left behind
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Debulking with visible tumor left behind

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Debulking with visible tumor left behind
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Debulking with visible tumor left behind
Surgical removal of an entire visible lesion, with no obvious lesion detected on post-operative evaluation; microscopic residual disease may be present.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of an entire visible lesion, with no obvious lesion detected on post-operative evaluation; microscopic residual disease may be present.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
